page.title: 07Housing in W.Itchenor
page.content: Among the older properties in Itchenor are the fishermen's cottages in The Street. A large number of houses were built in 1920 in varying styles mainly for weekend yachtsmen, but are now mostly permanently occupied. Most of the houses are built along the main road but there are a few side roads with small groups of houses. The popularity of the area is reflected in the price of properties making them largely out of reach of the younger age group. Most houses are owner occupied, some being secondary or holiday homes. There is main water and electricity and recently a new sewage system was installed but no mains gas. In the 1981 census there were 188 on the electoral roll, mostly middleaged or elderly people.
